Historically, successful communist movements have always required the backing of the working class, and so we cannot just write off a large section of the working class‚Äîeven if we may not agree on every social position.
[From Above]

author: @rsavage-r2v
text: I've been very skeptical, and I had a strongly negative view of Haz and Hinkle, but I agree with everything Eddie says here. I think the party would do well to pay special attention to its line on human reproduction and the feudal character of the family. In the streams that I've watched, everybody at MWM embraces an "anti-woke" rhetoric that makes them sound like they're tailing the Jordan Peterson far-Right, but in this discussion Eddie makes it clear that he knows the theory and has a correct materialist view. I think the way you talk about this could make a big difference.

I used to be a little skeptical of Haz, but Omene talks to him like once a month and has said some very interesting positive things‚Äîand this is after they had a heated 5 hour debate. I could find the YouTube if you‚Äôre interested.

@rsavage-r2v
replies.text:
@Lawns-Are-Fun Wow thanks for digging that up for me.

I see Nick is making the same mistake that a lot of the online ML community is doing, imagining that "Social Issues" somehow exist outside the material sphere. But I'm mostly with them here. I forget that Haz and Hinkle are in their 20s. They've come a long way, and if they're willing to be civil and put in the work I'll definitely give them a chance.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: @rsavage-r2vYeah there‚Äôs another one I mentioned‚ÄîI wish I could find it‚Äîwhere Q calls in to Haz‚Äôs stream and Q, being the older wiser dude pushes Haz to like let this edgy trolly stuff go because Q can recognize Haz was young but a very well read bright dude. It was kind of interesting because Haz kind of admits part of the reason he acts this way is because he‚Äôs so so tired of any time he‚Äôs focusing on international issues, philosophy, or theory, someone drags him down into the culture war social muck for like not saying the exact right new word out of academia or doing leftist signal hedging (stuff like where you‚Äôre trying to talk about one thing but you have to say ‚Äúand of course I‚Äôm not saying republican politicians are good but we shouldn‚Äôt give up on the working class MAGA voters‚Äù)‚Äîand he basically says something along the lines to Q of ‚ÄúYou know I used to be more careful and PC and really sensitive, but it was never good enough and I‚Äôm just tired of dealing with these banal topics and arguments with pseudo-leftists so I just do this to weed out people who are otherwise not serious.‚Äù Not sure it was the best idea strategically, but interestingly I think Q conversely lost more and more patience with the pseudo left himself and is also extremely tired of having to pander/signal to them when he wants to talk about real stuff and just be honest. I think you can see it in that clip I shared with you. Q says Haz is like me and is tired of wasting time with people.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text:
@rsavage-r2vand look on Jackson, I haven‚Äôt seen nearly as much of him as Haz, but here‚Äôs my cautiously optimistic take on him. 

I get he‚Äôs not perfect, but if he wanted he could be MUCH MUCH bigger and making way more money being a Dave Reuben ‚ÄúI was on the left now I‚Äôm a right wing republican‚Äù guy or a ‚ÄúI was a commie but we‚Äôve gotta get serious and vote blue‚Äù guy. Both of these options would be far more lucrative and avoid threats like he just faced in Venezuela. So for me, for now, I‚Äôm gonna see how it goes. Maybe he disappoints me and makes me look naive but you know , I‚Äôm in my mid 30s and I don‚Äôt wanna spend my whole life afraid to look foolish or naive because I hoped something could work. Otherwise you‚Äôre just a nihilistic doomer and at that point, why even care? So I‚Äôm going to have the courage to maybe look stupid and maybe get fooled. Oh well, could be worse ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

replies.author: @aesop1451
replies.text: Communists are uniquely positioned to take advantage of the situation. Trump exposed the uniparty (Bush, McCain, and Romney hate him). But he is ignorant or unwilling to defeat the Deep State. So Trumpers have a high amount of distrust of mainstream media. Unfortunately they do not have the most coherent worldview (they support  billionaires that want to microchip your brain).

replies.author: @numbersix8919
replies.text: Mild correction, the feudal form of the family is what we today call the "extended" family or multi-generational family.  It was a supportive institution under feudalism, and would still be under capitalism, in place of the so-called "nuclear family" which is alienating and creates market dependency.  Only with socialism will people be free to choose the kind of family that suits their development as individuals.

replies.author: @rsavage-r2v
replies.text:
@numbersix8919 Yes but don't forget the extraction of surplus labor from women, and their role as "privately owned means of production" who are used to keep birth rates high to ensure competitiveness in an agrarian society.

This is what liberals refer to as "heteropatriarchy" -- the enslavement of women and the violent repression of all behaviors or genetic traits that detract from maximum human reproduction.

I do think it's accurate to point to the supportive function of the extended family, especially in underdeveloped societies where domestic goods and services have yet to be commodified. This is why peasants and workers in periphery societies (even socialist ones) tend to be "socially conservative". They depend on their cousins etc to mend clothes and roofs, to produce cooked food under primitive conditions. This is why I agree to a large extent with the position taken by MWM that we shouldn't take what is effectively a utopian/adventurist line on human reproduction when the poorest Americans still very much rely on the domestic economy of the extended family.

I just mean that I think we need to be very clear about how we analyze this issue and very careful about how we articulate it.

And yes, I think what Eddie is very clearly alluding to is that "Abolish the Family" per Engels means "Abolish the family as a competitive economic unit," not that in an enlightened communist society everyone will be poly or whatever.

replies.author: @rsavage-r2v
replies.text: @numbersix8919 I highly recommend Paul Cockshott's "How the World Works". It has a whole chapter on the emergence of state society, including the mechanism of "stealing brides" in neolithic cultures to fortify birth rates, and the extraction of surplus labor from women. He also has at least one talk on his channel where he roughly quantifies the work done by women in medieval/early modern times (using joules or some appropriate unit I believe) and argues that between cooking, child-rearing and hauling water/fuel they were objectively doing more work.

replies.author: @rsavage-r2v
replies.text:
@Lawns-Are-Fun There's a recent video on S4A citing some old gems from Hinkle and Haz which, unless they have very much learned and moved beyond their radically incorrect and reactionary ideas, would totally invalidate anything else they have to say and the ACP by extension. I do hope these represent an earlier stage in their ideological development.

Haz seems to be saying that the ACP is some kind of trot/larouchite-style ponzi scheme. I really hope his comments can be shown to be inaccurate and unrepresentative. Bro, the Communist Party of China is not a "decentralized business made up of entrepreneurs and 'ethical landlords.' " I.e. an MLM (and not the kind with ultraleft guerillas).

replies.author: @numbersix8919
replies.text: @rsavage-r2v OK.  What's your point?  Seems like you're trying to make a point.  Out with it then, don't be shy.

replies.author: @rsavage-r2v
replies.text:
@numbersix8919 MWM and other "Patriotic Socialists" use right-tailist rhetoric ("anti-woke", hostility toward people who use "pronouns" etc.) and make incorrect statements asserting that "cultural issues" are somehow outside the material realm, but I know that some of the key people such as Liger are actually familiar with the relevant materialist analysis. I'm saying that anyone attempting to court the right-populist working class demographic should be very careful about how they approach these issues because there's a narrow path between alienating a working class that is dependent on feudal social forms versus embracing real reactionary hatred.

For example, liberals want to lowkey bomb Uganda to save the gay people because they are idealists and they consider that part of their White Man's Burden. Marxists know better, that conditions for gay people will improve when their society moves beyond semifeudal agrarian production. In the same sense, marxists should understand that leading with "Abolish The Family" in the rust belt is a bad idea, but we should understand it for materialist reasons, not because "Well Actually Communists Are Socially Conservative." Because we're not. Communists have always been ahead of their respective societies on issues related to sex and the family.

replies.author: @numbersix8919
replies.text:
@rsavage-r2v¬† Thanks for your answer.  There are 3 key points to keep in mind concerning the co-option (recuperation) and betrayal of the trans rights movement by bourgeois mass culture.  Senationalizing trans people and their aspirations and aggressively promoting them to a public without proper education and preparation is actually intended to make it unpopular, distasteful, and even in fact objectionable.  I'm sure many trans people feel this as well.  At the same time, making it a cause celebre and identifying it with progressive politics 1) again distances left politics from class issues 2) divides would-be leftists from actual leftists, and 3) sets the polis at war with itself over another "wedge issue" or "social" issue that has little place in politics once the freedoms of individuals and protection for people identified as members of an oppressed minority group are constutionally assured.  This has been going on since the Reagan era and the Moral Majority, leading to the present where the only permissible political discourse is devised specifically to eliminate any chance at class solidarity and split the Left.
The CPGB-ML's Jodi Brar has an orthodox Marxist take on the problem.  It's on YT, and I suggest you listen to it and see where you disagree.

23:49 The bigotry and homophobia are a concern I had too: even in the MWM Discord, I dealt homophobes a few times and then I got banned related to a heated conversation with a homophobe. 
   If you talk about a social issue for any reason, then you get treated with hate by some of that community, which is not helpful when they don‚Äôt live their neighbors as themselves. 
   But at the same time, the MWM Discord is not the ACP and the ACP is not the MWM Discord. The ACP is a better development honestly; and it doesn‚Äôt seem to promote or allow the prejudice that I experienced in the MWM Discord. 
   That‚Äôs likely because, like with racist white dudes who fought with slave labors to help the slave laborers free themselves, prejudice has to be put aside in a class struggle; and the MWM Discord is not class struggle in any way unlike what the ACP is created to help with ‚Äî the ACP wants to get something done for the proletarians which I admire.

replies.author: @EggEnjoyer
replies.text:
@seekingabsolution1907 First of all, if you think of small business owners as as being antagonist to the working class you‚Äôre off base. Not all petite bourgeoisie are the same. The small family owned restaurant and farmer who has a small market is not the same as a guy who 2 McDonald‚Äôs and makes hundreds of thousands off of owning labor and land. Wait until you find out how common it is to be a small business owner in socialists states like china. Imagine calling a street vendor petite bourgeoisie and an antagonist to the working class. Absurd.

Second, nothing you said changes the fact that most of maga is still just regular working class people

author: @mat_j
text: Pls stop this MAGA nonsense

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text:
Can you guys please stop being like this and try to actually grapple with the concept. It‚Äôs extremely lazy.

MAGA Communism isn‚Äôt about supporting republicans or Donald Trump or their policies. It‚Äôs a concept that focuses on the idea that MAGA is a popular working class movement and therefore it is a Communist‚Äôs duty to try to co-opt it. Historically, successful communist movements have always required the backing of the working class, and so we cannot just write off a large section of the working class‚Äîeven if we may not agree on every social position.

replies.author: @mat_j
replies.text: @Lawns-Are-Fun this concept is extremely lazy

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: @mat_jDude I‚Äôm serious can you just grapple with the concept? Like I‚Äôm tired of sniping and trash talking. Please try and think and if you don‚Äôt agree make an argument why it doesn‚Äôt make sense.

replies.author: @homieslice1996
replies.text:
@mat_j I live in the San Joaquin Valley, and nearly all counties in it supported Trump each time ‚Äî there‚Äôs something that they didn‚Äôt see fitting about Clinton or Biden (except for Fresno County where I live since it has the 5th biggest city in the state and it‚Äôs a college town), and it is lazy to brush them off. 
    Doesn‚Äôt mean we agree with much of anything that they say, but there is some common ground. Even if they might have disagreeable prejudices: that can be broken when the work with others for a common goal to see that those they saw as lesser actually have more in common. 
   Most of the San Joaquin Valley is proletarian, and most of them supported Trump. Finding common ground with some but not all of the grievances can give a class perspective to folks like former Bernie bros who went to Trump; likely lots of the MAGA proletarians are that way. 
   Even the local petty bourgeoise, semi-proletarians, and lumpen-bourgeoisie are screwed by the imperialist bourgeoise. It is lazy to ignore them too, since they home little to no economic or political power locally or nationally.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: ‚Å†@homieslice1996Exactly. Two of my neighbors are MAGA guys and all they do is complain to me about how 1) they hear we‚Äôre going to war with some new country they‚Äôve never heard of and 2) the publicly traded electric utility is gouging them.

replies.author: @homieslice1996
@JM57-99

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
@R.ion64
replies.text: ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã@Lawns-Are-FunI've always advocated ignoring people's personal beliefs and biases on issues having nothing to do with economics when trying to foment solidarity. Always. However the other side of that is that they understand not to bring those issues up either. It works both ways. And I didn't think that absolutely insisting on sane attitudes to public health should have been pushed as an exclusionary standard among groups getting together either,. What happened though was you have infantile jrks like many of the maga comm crowd who took that to the opposite and even more destructive extreme, pushing out explicitly anti-scientific garbage and dangerous skepticism along with contrarian socially backwards positions (adopted, i should add, much like a blue collar version of the dancing minstrels, in effect satirising poorly educated people),  So I can only hope intelligent people will get enough offline time to breathe in some sanity and ditch this contrarian garbage and return to what this channel used to be about; sound, intelligent non-nonsense education. Speed the hour.i agree with @mat_j here

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: @R.ion64This seems like a lot of vague dislike of vibes or something. Is ACP pushing bad policies or even social positions? I‚Äôm not seeing it. Now I agree, you can‚Äôt say don‚Äôt get involved in the social commentary and then make little barbs here and there. But, this naysaying and failure to grapple with some of their concepts just seems unwarranted. If I see it happen, I will reassess, but until then, I‚Äôm not going to be immobilized by fear.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: @R.ion64Okay, it seems like your sole issue is vaccines. Like I say to the Jimmy Dore fans or RFK fans‚Äîit‚Äôs not really my top priority. Everything else is just this Charlie Day meme of trying to find if Jackson is secretly bad. If he‚Äôs bad, it will become apparent and again, as I just said, I‚Äôll reassess. In the meantime I‚Äôm going to support the people pushing against US hegemony and trying to help the working class. Good luck üëç

replies.author: @R.ion64
replies.text: ‚Äã@Lawns-Are-Fun you mean like taking the "scientific" bit of "scientific socialism" seriously and not spreading dangerous, stupid conspiracy theories? Sure. If you call that morally superior, fine. I just call it good sense and sanity. But you're right. I've been hammering this ad nauseum to little or no effect. Do what you all want. We'll be seeing the consequences soon enough. I wish you peace.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
@R.ion64
replies.text: ‚Äã@Lawns-Are-Fun no, seriously I know how it is and how were all under huge pressure from the madness of social media etc and how easy it is to let yourself get sucked in. I'm sorry for coming across harsh. I only caution not to make problems for ourselves in the future by courting charlatans and egomaniacs. I think I've been clinging onto this channel too long hoping they'd turn back from where they're headed. I've probably been causing needless trouble that way.  I really do wish all the best for you and them, despite extreme reservations about their partners.

replies.author: @Lawns-Are-Fun
replies.text: @R.ion64Totally understand. Thank you for the back and forth. Appreciate the good faith critiques and concerns.

replies.author: @seekingabsolution1907
replies.text: ‚Äãtrying to coopt a fascist movement has not, historically speaking, ever ended well for socialists. The US is an imperialist settler colony, you can no more be a chest thumping patriotic american communist than you can be a proud zionist communist. It creates an inherent contradiction within your worldview that will make anti-imperialism nigh impossible and sabotage the movement in the long run. Just look what happened to the self proclaimed communists in Israel. Those places are now filled with ardent genocidal zionists. Is that what you want the fruit of all your efforts to be?

author: @larsetom1
text: Both "right" and "left" as political ideologies are bourgeois, they are capitalist constructs. As you know Marx started using the appellation "communist" to differentiate Marxists from the soup of socialists who were not revolutionaries. Back in the 1960's the left was characterized by its antiwar stance, its distrust of big business and government and its stalwart and principled defense of free speech. Today, those people are on the right, not left (the left, in practice, has abandoned those principles). You should abandon the left/right dichotomy. The left are not your allies and arguably have done more to insidiously distort Marxism and working class politics than the right.

replies.author: @seekingabsolution1907
replies.text: No not really. The terms have more merit than this maga communist nonsense.
